org.treetank.access

Class Storage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.treetank.access.Storage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IStorage

    public final class Storage
extends Object
implements IStorage
    This class represents one concrete database for enabling several ISession objects.
    Author:
    Sebastian Graf, University of Konstanz
    See Also:
    IStorage

    • Method Detail

      • createStorage

        public static boolean createStorage(StorageConfiguration pStorageConfig)
                             throws TTIOException
        Creating a storage. This includes loading the storageconfiguration, building up the structure and preparing everything for login.
        Parameters:
        pStorageConfig - which are used for the storage, including storage location
        Returns:
        true if creation is valid, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TTIOException - if something odd happens within the creation process.

      • truncateStorage

        public static void truncateStorage(StorageConfiguration pConf)
                            throws TTException
        Truncate a storage. This deletes all relevant data. All running sessions must be closed beforehand.
        Parameters:
        pConf - the storage at this path should be deleted.
        Throws:
        TTException - any kind of false Treetank behaviour

      • existsStorage

        public static boolean existsStorage(File pStoragePath)
        Check if Storage exists or not at a given path.
        Parameters:
        pStoragePath - to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if existing, false otherwise.

      • createResource

        public boolean createResource(ResourceConfiguration pResConf)
                       throws TTException
        Initialization of a resource. Since databases can consist out of several resources, those can be created within this method. This includes only the initialization, the creation of a suitable folder structure must take beforehand for example within the creation of properties. This is necessary because of Guice relying on completely provided structures for their data-backends.
        Specified by:
        createResource in interface IStorage
        Parameters:
        pResConf - the config of the resource
        Returns:
        boolean with true if successful, false otherwise
        Throws:
        TTIOException - if anything happens while creating the resource
        TTException

      • truncateResource

        public boolean truncateResource(SessionConfiguration pSesConf)
                         throws TTException
        Truncating a resource. This includes the removal of all data stored within this resource.
        Specified by:
        truncateResource in interface IStorage
        Parameters:
        pSesConf - storing the name of the resource
        Throws:
        TTException - if anything weird happens

      • openStorage

        public static IStorage openStorage(File pFile)
                            throws TTException
        Open database. A database can be opened only once. Afterwards the singleton instance bound to the File is given back.
        Parameters:
        pFile - where the database is located sessionConf a SessionConfiguration object to set up the session
        Returns:
        IStorage instance.
        Throws:
        TTException - if something odd happens
